content: const functionName = ( defaultParameter1 = "hello", defaultParameter2 = () => "world", defaultParameter3 = [{ otherText: "!" }] ) => `${defaultParameter1} ${defaultParameter2()}${ defaultParameter3[0].otherText }`; console.log(functionName()); // hello world!
summary: const functionName = ( defaultParameter1 = "hello", defaultParameter2 = () => "world", defaultParameter3 = [{ otherText: "!" }] ) => `${defaultParameter1} ${defaultParameter2()}${ defaultParameter3[0].otherText }`; console.log(functionName()); // hello world!
title: JavaScript: default parameter values

content: Returns a random integer 0 to 2 console.log(Math.floor(Math.random() * 3)); // 0, 1 or 2 1 to 3 console.log(Math.floor(Math.random() * 3) + 1); // 1, 2 or 3
summary: Returns a random integer 0 to 2 console.log(Math.floor(Math.random() * 3)); // 0, 1 or 2 1 to 3 console.log(Math.floor(Math.random() * 3) + 1); // 1, 2 or 3
title: JavaScript: get a random Number

content: let fullText = ""; const myArray1 = [{ helloText: ["hello"] }]; const myArray2 = ["world"]; const myArray3 = [ { function(parameter) { fullText += `${parameter} `; }, }, ]; [...myArray1[0].helloText, ...myArray2, " "].map((value) => { myArray3[0].function(value); }); console.log(`${fullText.trim()}!`); // hello world!
summary: let fullText = ""; const myArray1 = [{ helloText: ["hello"] }]; const myArray2 = ["world"]; const myArray3 = [ { function(parameter) { fullText += `${parameter} `; }, }, ]; [...myArray1[0].helloText, ...myArray2, " "].map((value) => { myArray3[0].function(value); }); console.log(`${fullText.trim()}!`); // hello world!
title: JavaScript: callback Function

content: List of falsy values false 0 -0 0n "", '', `` — empty string value. null — the absence of any value. undefined — the primitive value. NaN — not a number. document.all Check a falsy value is false Boolean() method: for (const item of [false, 0, "", null, undefined, document.all]) { console.log(`${item} is ${Boolean(item)}`); } NOT (!) operator method: for (const item of [false, 0, "", null, undefined, document.all]) { if (!item) { console.log(`${item} is ${!!item}`); } }

title: JavaScript: falsy values
JavaScript: creates a duplicate-free version of an Array

content: var myArray = [1, 2, 3]; var myArray2 = [4, 5, 6]; const randomArray = (parameter) => { return parameter[Math.floor(Math.random() * parameter.length)]; }; console.log(randomArray(myArray)); // 1, 2 or 3 console.log(randomArray([...myArray, ...myArray2])); // 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6
summary: var myArray = [1, 2, 3]; var myArray2 = [4, 5, 6]; const randomArray = (parameter) => { return parameter[Math.floor(Math.random() * parameter.length)]; }; console.log(randomArray(myArray)); // 1, 2 or 3 console.log(randomArray([...myArray, ...myArray2])); // 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6
title: JavaScript: get a random item from an Array
